alert.note: Alert for DeKalb; Jackson (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 1:40PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Jackson and northeastern DeKalb Counties through 215 PM CDT... At 138 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms just east of Stevenson to locations southeast of Bridgeport, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Bridgeport, Stevenson and Higdon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
